Desc:
Who We Are
Teranet is the exclusive provider of Ontario’s online property search and registration. We developed, own, and operate the Ontario Electronic Land Registration System — one of the most advanced, secure, and sophisticated land registration systems in the world. In Manitoba, Teranet owns and operates The Property Registry, providing certification of titles to land, maintaining land records, and offering reliable information of financial interests in personal property to the public. We are a Canadian company and a global Innovator in electronic services and solutions. We operate one of the most advanced and secure registration systems in the world. We are the market leader in Registry Services, with best-in-class solutions for real estate, financial services, law, and government. We have a fun and collaborative culture and are one of Canada’s top companies for employee engagement. We are a talent-driven organization and invest in our people and their career growth. We improve the lives and businesses of our clients.
About the Role
The Data & Analytics team within the Financial Solutions line of business has an ambitious mandate, where we are accountable for leveraging Data & Analytics to deliver business value both internally as well as to external clients through the following:
Enhance existing or create new products and services with proprietary data assets and partner with external data providers, through the application of data science
Design and deliver custom data solutions to fulfill specific client needs
Explore and analyze data to generate business insights to enhance decision-making
Demonstrate thought leadership in the ecosystem in which we operate
Identify and implement opportunities for operational efficiencies across the organization
In addition, this team will play an important role in evangelizing and educating the value of Data & Analytics to the rest of the organization, in support of cultivating a data-driven culture.
The Data Analyst will support these ambitious goals primarily through data collection and extraction, validating data quality and usability, and then providing insights through data visualization and business intelligence.
What will you be doing
The Data Analyst supports the team in the design, development, and implementation of data & analytics use cases through the following responsibilities:
Engage with stakeholders to understand business requirements and objectives for data & analytics use cases
Identify and then collect/extract the data sets required for the use case
Analyze, assess, and remedy the data for quality and usability
Document the processes and standards applied to ready the data for use
Constantly identify opportunities to enhance both the data quality and process used for each use case
Explore data to build foundational data knowledge in the subject domain, in partnership with data owners
Integrate disparate data sources into a usable data model to meet business requirements
Present business insights in a meaningful and intuitive manner, per the target audience, using visualization or BI tools
Develop automation for recurring visualizations or BI reporting packages
Investigate and document data anomalies and gaps through to resolution
For each net new use case, thorough documentation of the objectives, analysis process, methods, and findings to meet quality standards and production requirements
About You
You are someone who:
Is keen to understand the business – data analytics cannot be done in a vacuum – we need to be close to the business so that we understand what we are trying to solve and what the data means
Tells stories from data – data analytics is not data dump – it needs to be meaningful and intuitive to the end-user to realize the inherent business value
Challenges to the status quo – the state of business and the field of data analytics are constantly evolving, and we need to as well. Assumptions and old ways of doing things are open season, as long as you bring along workable and relevant solutions articulated professionally. Proactively pursue and learn about new analytical tools and methodologies to solve problems in new and innovative ways.
Is good at problem-solving – someone who can “connect the dots”, and have a logical and methodical way to tackle new and complex problems
Takes pride in your work – your work is diligent and thorough and you are proud of your reputation for high-quality and reliable work
Is a quick study – the successful candidate must be curious, resourceful, and dig into the weeds to ask the right questions and figure things out independently

the right questions and figure things out independently

Minimum 2 years of work experience in a Data Analyst capacity
Proficiency in SQL and Python (regular usage, practical experience)
Practical experience in data analysis: data cleansing, exploration, and modeling
Proficiency in using data visualization tools (Tableau), other BI tools (PowerBI), and Excel
Knowledge of Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Strong organization skills and discipline

Self-starter with ambition and enthusiasm

Actively build relationships and collaborate with stakeholders to further learning and develop meaningful solutions

A company with stability and strong government partnerships

An Opportunity to contribute to our teams and grow the Teranet brand

Title: Security Data Analyst
Desc:
The Security Engineering group within eSentire’s Threat Response Unit (TRU) is a central part of eSentire’s R&D efforts. This organisation works closely with high level security experts in various disciplines and in collaboration with our software engineering group, with a mission to innovate and develop new capabilities in our Atlas platform. The security data analyst supports the efforts of the team by creating rich and high-quality data models, formalizing analysis techniques to extract information, ontologies, and other artifacts that are meaningful and useful objects used to solve problems in cybersecurity. The successful candidate will explore and work with raw data from cybersecurity tools and processes on a regular basis and will develop formalized cybersecurity data deliverables for use in machine learning, data science, threat intelligence, and other cybersecurity disciplines. Day to day, you will work closely with cybersecurity experts from a variety of domains, applying your analytical and technical skills wherever possible to help solve cybersecurity problems that matter. You will get to regularly see your work used to improve security outcomes for our clients and will be on the leading edge to develop and author new investigative and analytical approaches when the next breaking security event challenges the industry, with access to rich and varied datasets not available to the public.

Job Responsibilities

Work with raw datasets, security technologies, and documented security processes to extract or infer data points of relevance to various models, creating data notebooks (e.g. Jupyter) to test your assumptions and formalize such transformations and processes as are necessary to create clean data outputs for use in cybersecurity.
Create and author various data deliverables and documents, contributing actively as a specialist in R&D project work in the field of cybersecurity. You will empower our various efforts with data and insights we need – helping to keep our data consistent in meaning across our various efforts and identifying when we need to introduce new terms into our ontology.
Work with data engineers, data scientists, and security practitioners to identify and source the data they need for new projects in machine learning, threat intelligence, and other applied security use cases.
Become and act as a subject matter expert on data you work with, communicating about your data deliverables clearly in both technical documentation and in person.

To be successful in this role, you will need

A masters or higher education in a scientific field or equivalent industry experience, where you have demonstrated and applied your analytical, technical, and data-oriented skills to create outputs conforming to some rigorous ontological standard.
A keen interest in cybersecurity, ideally you are familiar with one or more cybersecurity domain data models and have some prior background or completed project work in any information security domain.
Strong and demonstrated abilities for data work, data analysis, data science projects, and/or applying statistical or machine learning approaches to build useful inferred observations about data in applied projects that solve real-world problems.
An ability to independently identify and propose opportunities for how you can apply your unique skills and background to solve problems and create security value.
Strong verbal & written communication skills, with a proven ability to communicate complex concepts in layman’s terms and how your work brings value.

With growing operations internationally, there is lots of lateral and upward advancement opportunities for rewarding and developing careers with eSentire.  Habanero is looking to add this exciting full-time intermediate role to our already awesome team anywhere across Canada! This means you can work remotely anywhere in Canada or from one of our downtown offices in Vancouver, Calgary or Toronto, we're flexible! As an organization, we are passionate about creating exceptional experiences for our clients and their employees, and we believe that the best solutions begin and end with people. This is where you come in.
  


   To get a picture of what this role looks like, imagine yourself…
  

Part of an inclusive and diverse team of Habs, passionate about helping people and organizations thrive
Working with enterprise-sized clients to determine how their business can use Microsoft 365 most effectively
Leading customer discovery and planning sessions to uncover employee experience challenges and insights to designing effective solutions
Analyzing data from people analytics, surveys and ethnographic research to design exceptional digital employee experiences
Learning on behalf of our clients in order to consult with knowledge and confidence on how workplace technologies, processes, systems and culture can be designed to help people and the organizations they work in thrive
Working with clients and our awesome team of developers, designers, quality assurance specialists, and project managers to create award-winning solutions on our GO Intranet
Supporting and evolving the solutions you help create



   Chances are, you’re right for this role if you…
  

Bring experience working in a client-facing role, helping create intranets and implementing digital workplace programs of work
Are a good listener and clear communicator
Are keen to seek clarity from ambiguity and embrace complexity
Bring expertise in working with Microsoft SharePoint and/or Microsoft 365
Have experience facilitating in-person interviews and workshops
Are passionate about researching and analyzing client needs
Have experience organizing content and designing information architectures
Have portal management and governance knowledge
Are technically curious and up to date on current digital workplace trends – especially SharePoint, Viva and Microsoft 365 updates
Thrive in high-performing and non-hierarchical workplaces



   If you plan on working remotely or from home regularly, you have...
  

An appropriate remote work setup, such as a quiet space and a trusted and reliable internet connection
Access to internet speeds of at least 15 Mbps down and 5 Mbps up (having the ability to connect via Ethernet for troubleshooting is required)



   Bonus points if you have...
  

Experience with information architecture, experience design, and/or measurement and analytics
Experience with Power Platform, Power BI, ServiceNow and/or enterprise content management systems



The Hab hiring process
 As mentioned above, please address your cover letter to the hiring team at Habanero, and make sure to share: (1) why you think Habanero would be a great place to work, and (2) an interesting problem you have solved in your professional career.
   
 If we reach out, please expect a thorough interview process including some meet and greets with Habs, a 2-hour core competency interview and reference checks with past employers or other contacts. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all steps of our hiring process. While we’d love to meet everyone who applies, only those who are short-listed will be contacted. All applicants will receive a notification when the role is closed or filled. Thanks for taking the time to apply!
   

A little bit about Habanero
 Habanero is a Canadian consulting company with offices in Calgary, Toronto, Vancouver and Winnipeg. We are passionate about helping people and organizations thrive. We believe that every organization can be exceptional, and we help to humanize the world of work through the creation of modern workplaces and the cultural, communication, collaboration and content experiences that power them. Our solutions are globally recognized, and we have consecutively ranked as one of Canada's top ten best places to work for the last 11 years. Habanero is proud to be ranked #9 on the Great Place to Work® Canada List of Best Workplaces™ for 2021.
   

The best kind of work
 Habanero is an organization where people who are creative, hard-working, friendly, honest and open come together to do great work. We have a shared passion for solving complex issues that will benefit other people and organizations. We only hire people we can count on, so you can be certain that you are joining a team of happy and competent team members. We service our clients and projects across Canadian time zones and consultants are resourced on cross-regional teams.
   

Supporting each other in personal growth
 We are a lattice organization, meaning that there is no traditional hierarchy. There is no typical boss, and you don’t report to a manager. Instead, we have a more holistic approach to mentorship – we offer employee journey coaches who are there to help you with all things career and life. We believe it’s up to you to make the most out of your career, and we are here to support and encourage you every step of the way.
   

A diverse culture of clever humans
 At Habanero, we celebrate diversity and inclusivity. We are committed to creating and supporting equal employment opportunities regardless of age, race, ancestry, ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status or disability. We have included a personalized submission field in our application form to provide an additional opportunity for you to tell your story outside of the traditional resume and cover letter.
   

Compensation
 Our compensation package includes a technology allowance, a wellness allowance, flexible work hours, the option to work from home, health and dental coverage, a health spending account and RRSP matching. We also enjoy smaller perks like free snacks and drinks and group lunches where you can reconnect with your team after a long week. There are training and development opportunities for those who wish to continue evolving their skills. All employees start at three weeks of vacation.
   

Bringing life to work
 Everyone at Habanero probably has their own story around this, but it's probably safe to say that it starts with people feeling like they can bring their whole selves to work. The cornerstone idea is that we want to support people having great lives, not just great work lives (we can't say our relationship begins at 9:00 and ends at 5:00). Other things we've heard make the difference for Habs:
  

People starting their careers get to jump in and gain experience right away
Employee journey support system (career coach)
The culture of trust, transparency, inclusivity, collaboration, autonomy... to name a few
The awesome people that work here (of course)
Flexible work schedule
Training and development opportunities when we can support them


   We recently asked Habs to share what they feel makes us one of the Best Places to Work in Canada and the loudest response was 'our people' (with 'our teams' and 'balance' not far behind). So, if this sounds like something you want to be a part of, and you have the skills and experience to contribute, then we want to meet you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Desc:
Who We Are

About the Role
The Data & Analytics team within the Financial Solutions line of business has an ambitious mandate, where we are accountable for leveraging Data & Analytics to deliver business value both internally as well as to external clients through the following:
Enhance existing or create new products and services with proprietary data assets and partner with external data providers, through the application of data science
Design and deliver custom data solutions to fulfill specific client needs
Explore and analyze data to generate business insights to enhance decision-making
Demonstrate thought leadership in the ecosystem in which we operate
Identify and implement opportunities for operational efficiencies across the organization
In addition, this team will play an important role in evangelizing and educating the value of Data & Analytics to the rest of the organization, in support of cultivating a data-driven culture.
The Data Analyst will support these ambitious goals primarily through data collection and extraction, validating data quality and usability, and then providing insights through data visualization and business intelligence.
What will you be doing
The Senior Data Analyst is accountable for the entire lifecycle of each assigned analytics use case, from user requirements to delivery/production.
Data analysis, modeling, and storytelling (70%)
Engage with stakeholders (including external clients) to understand business requirements and objectives for data & analytics use cases
Identify and acquire the best data sources available to meet analytics objectives. Explore data to build foundational data knowledge in the subject domain, in partnership with data owners
Develop data models to support the identified analytics use cases. Partner with Data Engineers and Data Architect to implement the data models in the Big Data Platform
Present technical analyses and business insights in a meaningful and intuitive manner, per the target audience
For each use case, thorough documentation of the objectives, analysis process, methods, and findings to meet quality standards and production requirements
Actively partner with the Data Governance team to ensure that the use of data for each use case complies with Teranet policies and procedures
Actively evaluate existing data product/service to identify new tools, partners, or data that can enhance its performance
Mentoring and coaching junior team members (20%)
Delegate analysis and/or visualization tasks to more junior members of the team in support of the delivery of analytics use cases
Provide direction for and review the assigned work
Provide learning and growth opportunities to support the professional development of other team members
Contribute to developing Teranet Data & Analytics team to be best-in-class (10%)
Be attuned to the latest developments in Data & Analytics, and share learnings and ideas with the team to cultivate a spirit of innovation
As a team, develop a framework to standardize analysis processes, methodologies, and documentation
Provide feedback and suggestions to enhance and evolve our Analytics program to better meet our corporate goals
Evangelize the value of Data & Analytics at Teranet through engagement with the rest of the organization
About You
You are someone who:
Is keen to understand the business – data analytics cannot be done in a vacuum – we need to be close to the business so that we understand what we are trying to solve and what the data means
Tells stories from data – data analytics is not data dump – it needs to be meaningful and intuitive to the end-user to realize the inherent business value
Challenges to the status quo – the state of business and the field of data analytics are constantly evolving, and we need to as well. Assumptions and old ways of doing things are open season, as long as you bring along workable and relevant solutions articulated professionally. Proactively pursue and learn about new analytical tools and methodologies to solve problems in new and innovative ways.
Is good at problem-solving – someone who can “connect the dots”, and have a logical and methodical way to tackle new and complex problems
Takes pride in your work – your work is diligent and thorough and you are proud of your reputation for high-quality and reliable work
Is a quick study – the successful candidate must be curious, resourceful, and dig into the weeds to ask the right questions and figure things out independently
Technical Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field: Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering
Minimum 5 years of work experience in a Data Analyst capacity
Proficiency in SQL, Python (regular usage, practical experience)
Working knowledge of R
Deep experience in data analysis: data cleaning, exploration, and modeling
Practical experience in developing predictive and prescriptive models (Machine Learning)
Proficiency in using data visualization tools (Tableau) and other BI tools (PowerBI)
Practical experience working with Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Strong organization skills and discipline
Ability to balance multiple deliverables and manage projects to targeted milestones
Self-starter with ambition and enthusiasm
Agile and flexible to accommodate evolving deliverables in a challenging and ambiguous environment
Actively build relationships and collaborate with stakeholders to further learning and develop meaningful solutions
What We Offer
A competitive and comprehensive Total Rewards Package
A company with stability and strong government partnerships
An Opportunity to be part of an organization that is in growth mode through numerous acquisitions
An Opportunity to contribute to our teams and grow the Teranet brand
An environment where you will be challenged and supported daily
What’s It Like At Teranet
We operate through our core values
We have received numerous awards for our technologies and our successful partnership with the Government of Ontario.
We have been recognized as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 4 consecutive years.
We have a rich history, and we are pleased to make you a part of our exciting future
At Teranet, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we live and serve. Desc:

The Trans Mountain Expansion Project will provide increased capacity to support Canadian crude oil production growth and ensure access to global energy markets. Undergraduate degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar field, preferred.
3-6 years of project related experience.
Excellent Microsoft Excel skills.
Analytical mindset with demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Approaches challenges with mental tenacity and ability to overcome resistance and competing priorities.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence
Desc:

Title: Haskell Software Engineer - BI Software Development Team
